definition: next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time
"ice" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15), occurring in 冰[bing1], 次[ci4] etc, known as 兩點水|两点水[liang3 dian3 shui3]
number of times/frequency/order number (in a series)/power (math.)/degree of a polynomial (math.)

sentences.english: This competition is open to two categories: Open Category and Secondary Category.
sentences.chinese: 是次比赛分公开及中学组两组。

sentences.english: Finding should change standard of care, which is 4 doses every 3 weeks, researchers say.
sentences.chinese: 研究员说该发现将改变每3周4次给药的治疗标准。

sentences.english: Will they beat the 83 century record for the championships?Yes or no?
sentences.chinese: 他们这次比赛能打破原来83次单球破百的记录吗？

sentences.english: Chinese culture sees all non-Chinese as sub-human, to be exploited.
sentences.chinese: 中国文化把所有的其他人种视为有待剥削的次等民族。

sentences.english: They can nest up to eight times in a season, producing up to 800 eggs.
sentences.chinese: 一季中，它们可以上岸8次，产卵多达800枚。

sentences.english: 73 countries reported collecting fewer than 10 donations per 1000 population.
sentences.chinese: 据73个国家报告，每千人献血不到10次。

sentences.english: Regional and sub-regional organizations could play unique roles under the leadership of the United Nations. Financial support is important.
sentences.chinese: 区域和次区域组织可以在联合国领导下发挥独特作用。

sentences.english: The prevalence rates increased with increasing gravidity or parity.
sentences.chinese: 出生缺陷发生率随着孕产次的增加而明显提高。

sentences.english: There’s an American woman who has had 47 orthopedics.
sentences.chinese: 有一位美国妇女做了47次整形手术。

sentences.english: He leaves with a record of 39-6 with 30 knockouts .
sentences.chinese: 他留下了创记录的39胜6败，30次击倒对手。

sentences.english: The circuit can restrain odd order harmonic distortion and common model disturbing signal.
sentences.chinese: 该电路具有对偶次谐波及共模干扰信号具有抑制作用。

sentences.english: Manchester United have won the top division title in England no less than 19 times.
sentences.chinese: 曼联在以往的英格兰顶级联赛中至少成功夺魁19次。

sentences.english: In one such experiment he took 24, 576 measurements.
sentences.chinese: 仅这一个实验他就测量了24576次。

sentences.english: They propel themselves by using a small fin on their back that flutters up to 35 times per second.
sentences.chinese: 它们靠背上每秒钟扇动达35次的小鳍来推动自己。

sentences.english: To your mind, it looks like an ocean, but they are dimensions.
sentences.chinese: 对你的心智而言，它看起来条是海洋，但他们是次元。

sentences.english: Joachaz was three and twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 约阿哈次登极时二十三岁，在耶路撒冷为王三个月。

definition: threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
number of times/frequency/order number (in a series)/power (math.)/degree of a polynomial (math.)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
second (i.e. number two)/second time/twice/(math.) quadratic (of degree two)
